content.body: random q: in step 3.1 of Formatter in the console spec, it calls `String(arg)`: https://console.spec.whatwg.org/#formatter
content.formatted_body: random q: in step 3.1 of Formatter in the console spec, it calls String(arg): https://console.spec.whatwg.org/#formatter

content.body: this implies to me that `console.log(">%s<", ({ toString: () => { return 'custom' } }))` should print `>custom<`, which it does in FF, but not in Chrome (which instead prints `>Object<`)
content.formatted_body: this implies to me that console.log(">%s<", ({ toString: () => { return 'custom' } })) should print >custom<, which it does in FF, but not in Chrome (which instead prints >Object<)

content.body: am I misreading, or is Chrome not following the spec?
